oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RISK FACTORS FOR PIGLET MORTALITY IN DANISH ORGANIC PIG PRODUCTION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rangstrup-Christensen, Lena
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health and welfare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
HYPOTHESES – WORK IN PROGRESS
A proportion of piglets that are diagnosed as crushed have other potential underlying predisposing factors such as poor nutritional state, low birth weight or infectious diseases.  Poor health status, nutritional stage and high parity of the sow will increase the piglet mortality rates.  There is a significant difference of pre weaning mortality and causes of death both regarding the temporal distribution and in the individual variations between the farms.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Rangstrup-Christensen, Lena (2015) RISK FACTORS FOR PIGLET MORTALITY IN DANISH ORGANIC PIG PRODUCTION. Keynote presentation at: Pig welfare - what are the ways forward?, Copenhagen, Denmark, 29. april 2015.
